item.title: Build New Revenue with Remarketing for Search
item.description:
Remarketing lists for search ads (RLSAs) are a great way to enhance your current Adwords campaigns. They also let you bid on highly competitive keywords that might otherwise be too expensive.

We recommend you use RLSAs to capture revenue from site abandoners. When visitors leave your website without making a purchase, use these ads to reconnect with them as they continue searching Google. You can set your bids or select keywords more aggressively since these visitors have recently visited your website and/or shopping cart.

There are two basic strategies we recommend for search ads:

Optimize bids for your existing keywords or ad groups for those visitors on your remarketing lists. We typically increase our bids at least 100% and in some cases up to 300% when marketing to existing website visitors. This is a great way to be aggressive in the competitive Google Shopping area as well.

Optimize Keywords: You can bid on keywords that you wouldn’t normally include when you’re focused on just shoppers who have recently visited your site. For example, bid on generic keywords only for people who have visited your site in the last 30 days.

Reminder: Unlike Display Remarketing, which only requires 100 cookies before the list can be used, a remarketing list for Google search ads needs to have a minimum number of 1,000 cookies before the list can be used.

Interested in seeing what Remarketing for Search can do for your sales? Or looking for a broader digital marketing strategy checkup? The CV3 Marketing team can help. Contact us to learn more.

item.title: CommCon 2016: The 2016 Communiqué User Conference
item.description:
The 2016 Communiqué User Conference is a solutions oriented conference with great content, tons of networking with other Communiqué and Stone Edge users, and lots of practical ideas in an intimate setting at the Walt Disney World Swan and Dolphin Resort.  We are certain you will agree this is the can’t-miss conference of 2016.

Register today to reserve your seat for the 2nd annual Communiqué User Conference - CommCon 2016. Attendance is limited to the first 150 attendees, so sign up now to reserve your seat before it’s sold out.

The event is scheduled for April 1st - 3rd, 2016

item.title: Customer Success Story: Kitchen Kettle Village
item.description:
Next up in our client success series, we’d like to introduce you to Kitchen Kettle Village (shop.kitchenkettle.com), and its Operations Coach, Chris Dydol.

Nestled in Lancaster County’s Pennsylvania Dutch Country, Kitchen Kettle has a sweetly charming entrepreneur’s story behind it: Founder Pat Burnley and her husband, Bob, started their business in their garage, preserving jams and jellies. Soon, the garage itself became a tourist attraction, as visitors stopped by to observe the jelly-making process, and enjoy a cup of coffee and a sample of freshly made jellies.

Today, that garage start-up has grown into an expansive shopping destination, with more than 40 retail tenants, including clothing shops, food crafters, artisans, restaurants, and visitor lodging, plus regular food festivals and special events to foster a community experience.

Chris shares with us Kitchen Kettle’s eCommerce experience and history with CV3:

CV3: How are you selling products today?

KKV: The main outlet is a physical shop within our Village of 40 retail shops. We also wholesale products, and obviously sell online via CV3. What caused you to seek a solution like CommerceV3?

Initially we were looking for customization of product purchasing method, and being able to have a site that could represent not only our brick and mortar shopping experience, but also our entire Village shopping experience. CV3: Did your company already have a solution in place? Is there a specific incident that stands out that made it obvious a new solution was needed?

We originally had been with CV3, and then considered alternative online shopping vendors upon the suggestion of an external marketing agency. We quickly realized that other vendors’ platforms were not able to handle our custom requests in a cost efficient manner. As you searched for a solution, what questions were you looking to have answered?

Customization – to fit our current shopping experience but also to have the ability to grow as our Village grows. We were also very concerned with the level of direct support available as we grow. How long have you been using CommerceV3 at your company at this point?

We started in 2011, and then begin our “version 2.0” for about 1 month now. How are you using CommerceV3 in your everyday operations?

Our online store presence feeds directly into our own internal order processing/fulfillment system. What features/capabilities do you use the most? Are you leveraging our solution for any interesting/unexpected use cases?

Quantity discounting, recipe suggestions, related product suggestions, and promo code capability. What overall business benefits have you seen since implementing our solution?

Average order has increased, along with the benefit of having the online shopping experience that resembles the shopping experience in our Village. What process improvements have you seen, such as fewer mistakes, better data management, reduced time/costs, etc.?

We’ve noted less guest confusion in regards to product selection, especially from different size categories. What improvements have you seen in your services to your own customers?

Flexibility in ordering, improved ease of shopping our various product lines. What are the company goals that you hope to accomplish in the future that you can share?

Continued sustainable online sales growth by adding additional “stores” within the site to emulate and enhance our guest’s shopping experience, and expand our online product lines in conjunction with our Village concept. A big thank you to Kitchen Kettle Village and Chris Dydol for sharing their experiences with us!

If you would like to share your company’s story, let us know!

item.title: About Us
item.description:
When you have a problem, you will get a knowledgeable person on the phone who will fix your issues the first time.

Like the platform, the entire company is web-based, meaning everyone works from a space of their own choosing. It’s good for the environment and it helps us get more done, faster! We are a company of innovators and technology rockstars.

Leadership Team

Blake Ellis

Founding Partner & Chief Executive Officer

Blake Ellis often gets tagged as a “serial entrepreneur”, having been involved in a number of web-based start-ups. Most of his efforts fail spectacularly, but the ones that survive seem to do very well. In addition to CommerceV3, the successes include Rails Machine, Smack Dab Studios, ResEngine, and Timberline Interactive.

Blake has won numerous technology awards for CommerceV3 and Rails Machine, including the CBETA Innovation Award and graduation from the Advanced Technology Development Center at Georgia Tech.

Nathan Focht

Founding Partner & President

Nathan is the heart and soul of CommerceV3, relentlessly driving the platform from its humble beginnings to ever greater heights. He is quick to answer his cell phone, even when things are going wrong, and he’s just as quick to give you a straight and honest answer, even if you were wanting a bit of fluff.

More catalog merchant than software developer, Nathan breaks new ground by reinventing tried and true retail techniques to sell more online. He re-envisioned “square inch analysis,” a staple of print catalogs, and brought it into the 21st century for application to online sales. He routinely devises new ways of offering customer segmentation and promo codes, something you will love and hate if you ever have the opportunity to sift through the thousands of permutations available in CV3.

Nathan has won numerous awards for CommerceV3 and was the driving force behind the 2009 acquisition of Timberline Interactive.

item.title: Careers
item.description:
We come together for user group conferences, on-site work sessions, camping trips and the occasional paintball massacre. We also interact daily via video conferences, conference calls and instant messaging. It’s a “do-it-yourself” culture that’s not for everyone, but if you are a self-starter and proficient with web-based communication tools, it could be for you!

We currently are actively recruiting for the following positions:

  • Business Development Representative
  • Customer Support Specialist
  • Online Marketing Specialist
  • Sales Representative

Send your application, and why you think you’d be a great addition to our team to: jobs@commercev3.com.

item.title: Cloud Hosting
item.description:
Certified Secure

PCI-DSS Compliant platform with Level 1 VISA Certification

The CV3 platform undergoes rigorous and continuous testing by security firms, and the entire platform is certified annually by third party auditors. So CV3 is not only compliant software, but certified software, and it’s certified at the highest level available.

Fully Automatic

No maintenance, upgrades, or hardware headaches

Licensing software is often just the beginning of your investment, but at CV3 everything is included: software upgrades, bug fixes, firewalls, routers, redundant servers, redundant connections, geographically diverse fail-over, system administrators, pager duty… the list goes on an on. The short version: we take care of everything so you can focus on selling product.

Flex Up & Down

Add hosting resources for busy times, thin down off-season

Internet traffic fluctuates, sometimes on a regular cycle and sometimes because of an external event like a Superbowl ad. At CV3 we have multiple layers of automatic service allocation going on at any given time. New servers spin up as load increases in the morning and then spin down in the middle of the night. New clusters appear as Cyber Monday approaches and stick around as long as they are needed during the holiday season. All this activity means your store always has plenty of bandwidth for shoppers but you are paying for it when you don’t need it.

Edge Speed with CDN

Built-in content delivery network for faster page delivery

Speed is a priority at CV3, and milliseconds count. Content Delivery Networks (CDNs) are built directly into the way CV3 works, so your data is housed as close to the shopper as possible so your site pops into their browser when they visit. And our CDN usage is easy maintain over time, it works in the background so you don’t accidentally put a bunch of product images in the wrong place.

Redundant Data Centers

Stores are deployed to virtual data centers for true cloud redundancy

CV3 offers multiple layers of redundancy. Clustered server instances mean your shoppers never see a slow down, even if traffic gets high or a couple of instances decide to crash. And if an entire data center goes down (we’ve seen it happen many times), your stores are replicated across multiple data centers in different geographic regions so you don’t have to worry.

Top Tier Add-ons

Globally distributed DNS, mail servers, blog hosting & more

A successful storefront needs a whole network of supporting services, and your platform is only as strong as its weakest link. No one will get to your super fancy redundant servers if your DNS provider goes down. At CV3 we partner with top-tier global firms like Amazon, NuStar, Rackspace and Sendgrid to make sure all your supporting services are just as stable as your web store.

item.description:
Schedule a Demo

The best way to evaluate CV3 is to take it for a test drive. Contact our sales team at 888-544-2211 or sales@commercev3.com to schedule a great time for a demo.

Get Support

item.title: Features
item.description:
Platform Specs & Certifications

  • fast & flexible cloud-based application
  • multi-server, multi-datacenter
  • dedicated SQL-based cloud storage
  • edge CDN for binary assets
  • global, multi-homed DNS
  • on-demand resource scaling
  • PCI-DSS Level 1 VISA Certification
  • full backup rotation & code escrow

Customization & Branding

  • 100% editable site, including checkout
  • raw HTML & CSS & javascript access
  • open source theming engine (Smarty)
  • HTML5 & CSS3 enabled by default
  • Responsive mobile design
  • HTML & JS framework friendly
  • Legacy browser support via Modernizr
  • PHP-style code support
  • re-usable “building blocks” of code
  • staging area for reviewing changes
  • internal file and image libraries
  • A/B testing, including Google W.O.

Web Shopping

  • flexible product search
  • search filtering and results ordering
  • optional support for SLI Advance Search
  • nested category browsing
  • multiple-product images & videos
  • support for image zoom & effects
  • product ratings & reviews
  • optional inventory control
  • related products & required products
  • parent / child products
  • product attributes & sets
  • volume pricing discounts
  • minimum quantity limits
  • customizable products
  • product assemblies

Mobile Shopping

  • Responsive, mobile-first design
  • use HTML5, JQuery Mobile and more…
  • target multiple mobile platforms
  • shopper toggle between mobile & web
  • configurable default for tablets
  • ajax-based content loading
  • full shopping & expedited checkout
  • theme updates retain customizations

Social Shopping

  • Facebook like buttons
  • product ratings & reviews
  • share buttons, e-mail products to friends
  • Embedded shopping in Facebook

International Features

  • language-specific theme support
  • set language-specific currency
  • international shipping
  • international payments

Traffic-building / SEO

  • customizable, friendly URLs
  • canonical URLs
  • customizable meta-data per page
  • additional user-defined page data
  • redirect mapping
  • landing pages with add-to-cart
  • Google Site Map support

Membership

  • view previous orders / track orders
  • quick-reorder / address book
  • view gift certificate balance

Marketing & Promotions

  • catalog request & e-mail sign-up
  • referrer tracking & media code support
  • add-to-cart dynamic landing pages
  • segmented customer groups
  • behavioral group triggers
  • individual & group promo codes
  • single-use promo codes
  • fixed & percentage promos
  • category-based promos
  • free shipping promos
  • volume-based discounts
  • customer-based discounts
  • “stackable” promos & exclusions
  • link-based auto-adds

Checkout

  • express & full checkouts
  • member & non-member ordering
  • fully branded checkout
  • custom SSL certificate
  • pre-checkout recipient mapping
  • pre-checkout shipping estimator
  • Amazon / Google / Paypal checkout

Shipping & Tax

  • multiple-ship to support
  • shipping tables, groups and shippers
  • product-specific shipping rates
  • perishable shipping
  • Fed-Ex / UPS / USPO integration
  • custom shipping API
  • custom tax tables
  • multi-state tax exemptions
  • product-specific tax exemptions
  • Avalara / Exactor / CCH tax integration
  • custom tax API

Payments

  • purchase orders & invoice me
  • gift certificate & card on file
  • electronic check / eCheck.net
  • private label credit cards
  • Authorize.net / Chase Paymentech
  • Paypal’s Payflow Pro & Payflow Link
  • Paypal’s Web Site Payments
  • TransFirst ePay / USA ePay
  • Sterling / Litle & Co / Virtual Merchant
  • Mercury Payment Systems

Order Management

  • order batch processing & PDF copies
  • Mail Order Manager integration
  • Quickbooks Enterprise integration
  • StoneEdge Order Manager integration
  • Natural Order integration
  • NewHaven CMS & Wizard integration
  • OrderMotion integration
  • CoLinear Response integration

Reporting & Analytics

  • Google Analytics integration
  • full traffic & revenue reporting
  • virtual square-inch analysis
  • competitor tracking
  • percentile key metrics ratings

API / External Access

  • secure SOAP-based XML API
  • two-way information exchange
  • update product details
  • update inventory counts
  • batch process orders
  • sync customer data
  • push shipping status/tracking number

item.title: Growth Services
item.description:
Online Marketing & CV3 Experts

A Proven, Active & Responsive Leader in Multi-channel Retail

Our team includes SEO experts, paid search campaign managers, email campaign designers, site usability experts, web programmers and systems administrators.

We have launched hundreds of storefronts and helped our customers generate more than a billion dollars in revenue online. And unlike much of our competition, we’re not just consultants. We suggest tools and then roll up our sleeves and install them. We craft elegant designs, then cut them up and build out HTML pages. We hone email copy and then test it through various email ﬁlters for high-deliverability. We help our clients rank well in the search engines and get positive ROI from online advertising.

In short, we don’t just create a map and send you off on your own. We work right alongside you to help you succeed.

Our Team

Part consultant, part developer, part marketer.

CV3 works in concert with clients. We effectively provide the type of services, solutions and skills required to achieve success in today’s highly competitive online marketplace. We build relationships on a foundation of trust and with an eye towards long-term success. Our team is comprised of online marketing experts, professional designers, software developers, client specialists, team developers and network specialists.

Learn More

Marketing

CV3 wants to be more than just your eCommerce platform, we want to be your growth partner. Let us utilize our extensive knowledge of the digital universe and make us a part of your planning, research, development, marketing, social interaction and analysis …

Partner Program

CV3 Exclusive Partner Program With our innovative Partner Program you’ll receive proactive guidance with your online marketing and focused attention to help guide your website, all centered on growing your e-commerce sales. We will provide the str…

Email Marketing

Taking email marketing to the next level

  • Bronto

item.title: Marketing
item.description:
Your continued success is important to both of us, so who better to implement your digital marketing than a company that is vested in your success?

What We Offer

Initial evaluation of your online marketing goals resulting in a custom crafted plan of initial and long term recommendations. Goal: Increase sales by bringing additional qualiﬁed trafﬁc to your site, and additionally driving a higher conversion rate.

Paid Search (PPC) – We’ll help you hone and optimize your AdWords advertising to reach your ROI and budget goals. CV3 deliverables may include: key term research, installation of tracking codes, development of multiple campaigns and ad groups.

Remarketing Banner Ads Set up and Installation – this is an extension of your PPC campaign and shows visitors to your site (who then leave without purchasing) ads when they visit other sites.

Google Shopping Submission – We strongly recommend Google Shopping ads. These ads generate sales and provide good exposure through the prominence given to the shopping results on Google search results pages. CV3 will create a product feed, add Google Analytics tracking codes, and submit it to Google Shopping.

Email campaign suggestions and expert advice – We’ll make recommendations on how to enhance the design and content of your emails to increase your sales. And then we’ll help you execute those ideas.

Email Template Design/Code – It takes just a split second for an email recipient to choose whether to engage with an incoming email. CV3 has done extensive research in effective email design and successful deliverability. Our designers use the latest email code standards to ensure the highest rates of deliverability, as well as proven design features to elicit high click through rates.

Checkout Optimization – CV3 marketing experts will review and optimize the shopping cart and checkout process with an eye towards removing obstacles to conversion, deleting unneeded form ﬁelds or checkout steps, and adding images or messages that emphasize security and guarantee. We may also adjust button hierarchy and design on each page, create a custom shopping cart header, and remove unnecessary menu links which keep customers from completing the checkout process.

Search Engine Optimization – We’ll work to ensure that your website is optimized. You can also rely on us to provide ongoing guidance on good SEO practices as part of your monthly services. Search engine optimization will include: keyword research, development of title tags, meta descriptions for your home page and category pages, setup of a Google Webmaster Tools account, and submission of your new sitemap to Google and Bing.

Google Analytics Installation and enhancement – Google Analytics is our analytics platform of choice, and we conﬁgure it for your website. We’ll double check the installed analytics code on the site, and setup checkout goals and funnels and analyze the results as they come in.

Project Management – We will oversee and manage these projects and work with your team to coordinate email dates, PPC scope, etc.

Social Media guidance – our team can review your current social media efforts and provide suggestions. Often we can give you recommendations and then provide training to your own staff so they can do the posts.

Mobile – We can also help you evaluate your mobile CSS and make recommendations to increase conversion.

item.title: Partner Program
item.description:
CV3 Exclusive Partner Program

We will provide the strategy and execution of all initiatives around SEO, PPC, email, website optimization to drive revenue growth within your store. The Partner Program is paid for by way of a small revenue share of the growth that we help you to realize, therefore, we have a vested interest in your success.

CommerceV3 is inviting you to join our exclusive Partner Program Community. We have isolated our key assets and personnel to support members of this top tier community with remarkable support for every part of your website. Here’s how your business would benefit:

Dedicated phone and email support with ONE contact point

You will be assigned a dedicated account executive to manage the team and the tools engaged in growing your business.

Direct access to staff in all key areas including:

  • On-Going Site Development and Enhancements – be the first to implement the newest tools to engage your customers
  • Digital Marketing
  • Social Media
  • Application Training – Email, interactive, and Phone

Monthly Marketing Calls/Review

Monthly calls to review digital marketing and social media analytics and adjust marketing tactics accordingly

25% discount on all production and development work

Because we are now aligned to your success, we will share in the cost of development and production by providing a significant discount.

Annual Goals Planning

Site Review and marketing planning to achieve your annual sales goals.
